Name: Bernadette Hyland
Title: CEO
bio:
Bernadette Hyland is the CEO at 3 Round Stones, the provider of Callimachus Enterprise, a leading platform for creating data-intensive applications. Her role in promoting revenue-generating activities builds on over 20 years of experience in wide-scale information management strategy and technology roles. In addition to co-founding and serving as CEO of profitable software organizations in the U.S. and Australia, Ms. Hyland has held leadership positions at financial services firms including Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs. Prior to founding 3 Round Stones, she served as CEO of the Web services firm Zepheira. In 2005, she assisted in the acquisition of Tucana Technologies by Northrop Grumman.
Ms. Hyland is an expert in international Web data standards (W3C) and has written over a dozen publications on best practices for online complex data publication. She holds a bachelor’s degree in computer sciences and linguistics from UCLA.

Name: Barry Myers
Title: CEO
bio:
Barry Lee Myers became the CEO of AccuWeather, Inc. in State College, Pennsylvania in 2007. Prior to assuming his current role, Dr. Myers served as the Executive Vice President and General Counsel of AccuWeather. In the 2001 and 2007 meetings of the U.N.’s World Meterological Organization Meetings in Geneva, Switzerland, Dr. Myers served as an advisor to the Director of the U.S. National Weather Service. He has served on the Board of Directors of the American Weather and Climate Industry Association, the trade association representing the weather industry, since 1990, and has held the role of the industry’s chief federal-relations officer. He is a member of the American Meteorological Society.
For 18 years, Dr. Myers served on the faculty of Penn State’s Smeal College of Business. Dr. Myers received a B.S. in business administration and economics from Pennsylvania State University and a J.D. from Boston University School of Law.

Name: Ariel Gold
Title: Program Manager, World Wide Public Sector
bio: Ariel Gold serves as a Program Manager for Global Public Sector at Amazon.

Name: Frank Digiammarino
Title: Director, Global Public Sector
bio: Frank DiGiammarino serves as Director of Global Public Sector at Amazon. Before joining Amazon, he served in the White House where he was Deputy to the Special Advisor to the President for Recovery Implementation as a team leader responsible for disbursement of stimulus funds under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act. His previous experience includes a stint as Vice President of Strategic Initiatives at the National Academy of Public Administration, and as a senior consultant and strategist at Touchstone Consulting, Sapient Corporation, and American Management Systems. Mr. DiGiammarino holds a master’s degree in Public Administration from The George Washington University and a bachelor’s degree from the University of Massachusetts.

Name: Robert Glass
Title: Federal Solution Architect
bio: Bob has served as a leading expert in the U.S. Intelligence Community (IC) for the past 22 years. In 1992, he left college early to work for the Defense Mapping Agency where he served and eventually supervised all mainframe computer operations. During this time he decided to complete his degree attending night school at Strayer University and received his B.S. in 2000. He decided to continue his career in the private sector while still supporting National Security clients as a contractor and eventually a vendor. He went onto complete his M.S. in Software Engineering from George Mason University and graduated magna cum laude in 2007. He recently served as a Principal Solution Architect for the IC the past 8 years with Oracle's National Security Group. Bob has written for several government publications and is known within his domain as an expert SOA and Cloud architect.

Name: Ashley De Smeth
Title: Director of Development and Government Affairs
bio: Ashley De Smeth serves as Director of Development and Government Affiars at Appallicious. Previously, she served in the White House Office of Legislative Affairs as an Interagency Liaison and as Director of Government and Nonprofit Affairs for Crowdtilt, the world’s largest funding platform. Ms. De Smeth holds a master’s degree from the Goldman School of Public Policy at the University of California, Berkeley.

Name: Sarah Cordivano
Title: Project Manager, Data Analytics team
bio:
Sarah Cordivano is the project manager of the Data Analytics team at Azavea, a geospatial software and analysis company for web and mobile platforms. At Azavea, she has supervised the development of the Cicero API and Summer of Maps Program. Prior to joining the company, Ms. Cordivano served as a GIS specialist for the City of Philadelphia in the Office of Innovation and Technology. 
 Ms. Cordivano holds a bachelor’s degree from Temple University in Geography and Urban Studies and a master’s from the University of Pennsylvania School of Design in Urban Spatial Analytics.

Name: Laura McNulty
Title: Manager, National Government Health & Sciences Team
bio: Laura McNulty is the Manager of the National Government Health & Sciences Team at Esri.

Name: George Ivanov
Title: Public Policy and Government Relations Analyst
bio: George Ivanov serves as a Public Policy and Government Relations Analyst with Google in their Washington, D.C. office. He holds a master’s degree in International Science & Technology Policy as well as a bachelor’s degree in International Affairs, both from George Washington University.

Name: Stephen Marley
Title: Chief Technologist
bio: Steven Marley is a Systems Engineer/Chief Technologist at Harris Corporation.

Name: Steven Adler
Title: SA - Information Strategist
bio:
Steven Adler has been the information strategist at IBM since 2000, where he founded the IBM Data Governance Council, Information Governance Community, and created the Data Governance Maturity Model, among other accomplishments. In 2008, he was named among the top 100 most influential people in financial services by Treasury & Risk Magazine. He serves as a committee co-chair in two non-profit organizations: the Data on the Web Best Practices Working Group at W3C, and the XMILE Technical Committee at Oasis.
Mr. Adler has taught Data Governance at the NY Stern School of Business and serves on the Steering Committee of the Global Forum. He holds a bachelor’s degree in History and Economics from the George Washington University.

Name: Roslyn Docktor
Title: IBM Governmental Programs Executive
bio:
Roslyn Docktor is a Governmental Programs Executive at IBM. 
Ms. Docktor is one of the first 100 IBM employees to participate in the IBM Corporate Service Corps, through which she traveled to Ghana.

Name: Ty Beltramo
Title: CTO
bio:
Ty Beltramo is the Chief Technology Officer at MapQuest, where he leads technology and systems development operations for the company. In this role, he has developed MapQuest’s iOS apps, including the application’s gas price identification functionality. He previously served as the mobile engineering technical director and as a software engineer at MapQuest. Before joining MapQuest, Mr. Beltramo designed applications and systems architecture for Portable Hole Productions and TeleAtlas. Earlier in his career, he was the chief architect at General Motors’ OnStar enterprise.
He received a B.A. in Humanities from William Tyndale College.

Name: Michael White
Title: OnDeck’s Senior Risk Analyst
bio: Michael White is the Senior Risk Analyst at On Deck Capital, Inc, which lends billions of dollars to small business across the country. Prior to his current position, Mr. White served as the Senior Manager – Credit Analytics at On Deck Capital. Before joining On Deck Capital, Mr. White was a Senior Business Analyst at Capital One. He holds a bachelor’s degree from Georgetown University.

Name: Bala Venkatesan
Title: Vice President, Technology
bio: Bala Venkatesan serves as Vice President of Technology at Overture Technologies. Mr. Venkatesan has 14 years of IT experience as a developer of web-based software solutions, including leading the design and development of Overture’s more complex financial transaction processing solutions. Previously, Mr. Venkatesan worked at Sengen Inc., US Interactive, and Sun Microsystems. He holds a B.S. in Computer Science from the University of Madras and a Masters in Technology Management from the University of Maryland, College Park.

Name: Elizabeth Nash
Title: Director of Data and Product Development
bio:
Elizabeth Nash has been the Director of Data and Product Development at PolicyMap since 2007. As Director, she maintains all data for the company, which provides the web’s largest geo-database and supplies U.S. data and mapping information to myriad of public, private, and academic institutions. Ms. Nash also helped design PolicyMap in its nascent stages. Prior to joining the company, she served as the Manager of Marketing and Business Development at the Lawrence Group.

Ms. Nash received a bachelor's degree in history with a minor in mathematics from Bryn Mawr College and a master's in urban and regional planning from Rutgers University.

Name: Jim Dreyer
Title: Leadership Director in the PwC Risk Assurance Information Technology & Process Assurance XBRL services practice group
bio: Jim Dreyer is the Leadership Director in the PwC Risk Assurance Information Technology & Process Assurance XBRL services practice group.

Name: Andrew Beveridge
Title: Co-Founder and CEO
bio: Andrew Beveridge serves as President and CEO of Social Explorer and as a Professor of Sociology at Queens College. Dr. Beveridge is an expert in the use of geographic information systems (GIS) to integrate demographic materials, and has consulted widely on demographic and social science data in addition to his work in web-based map and data services with Social Explorer. Dr. Beveridge earned a Ph.D., M.Phil., and bachelor’s degrees from Yale University.

Name: Kenneth Melero
Title: Director of Federal
bio: Kenneth Melero is the Director of Federal Sales at Socrata, a cloud-software company dedicated to helping government agencies expand access to their data. He has worked for over 20 years in small business settings, promoting profitability through his leadership in the sales and technology sectors. He previously served at PIXIA Corp. as a Senior Director and at SPADAC Inc. as the Vice President of Product Sales.

Name: Bryson Koehler
Title: EVP, CIO
bio:
Bryson Koehler is the executive vice president and chief information officer of the Weather Company, where he oversees the strategy, financial planning, and technical operations of the company. Before joining the Weather Company, Mr. Koehler worked at the private equity firm Exigen Capital as an operating partner managing firm investment in the entertainment and travel sectors. In 2010, he was named “One to Watch” by CIO Magazine. Earlier in his career, Mr. Koehler served at InterContinetnal Hotels Group as the senior vice president of global revenue and guest technology. He was also the Director of Global Sales at Vicorp. . He currently serves on the Board of Directors of Atlanta Habitat for Humanity and the Technology Association of Georgia.
Koehler holds a bachelor’s degree in political science and in communications from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.

Name: Aaron Greenspan
Title: President and CEO
bio:
Aaron Greenspan formed Think Computer Corporation in 1998 when he began offering IT consulting services from his bedroom in Shaker Heights, Ohio. With demand high due to the dot-com boom, he quickly found it necessary to hire a few of his fellow classmates. Upon graduating from high school, Aaron changed the focus of the company from consulting to software development. Today, Think operates the integrated FaceCash mobile payment system and ThinkLink accounting network.

Shortly after starting Think Computer Corporation, Aaron spearheaded the creation of Think Computer Foundation, a 501(c)3 non-profit organization with the goal of helping children through technology. While attending Harvard College, Aaron created a web site in September, 2003 referred to as "The Facebook," inspiring the separate creation of Facebook, Inc. He is the author of "Authoritas: One Student's Harvard Admissions and the Founding of the Facebook Era" and various other essays.

Through the Advanced Standing program, Aaron graduated cum laude from Harvard College in three years with an A.B. in Economics.

Name: Arleen Zank
Title: Founder and Editor in Chief
bio:
Arleen Zank is the founder and Editor in Chief of Way Better Patents, a non-profit digital information services provider. Previously, she served for 22 years as the president of Coronando Group, Ltd, a company she also co-founded. Ms. Zank also worked as a program director at Wang Laboratories. Ms. Zank has over 25 years of experience in the information services field.
Ms. Zank received a B.A. from George Washington University.

Name: John Horrigan
Title: Consultant
bio:
John Horrigan, Ph.D. is a consultant for Pew and a Senior Research Fellow of the Joint Center for Political and Economic Studies’ Media and Technology Institute. The Institute studies how upcoming technologies can be utilized for the advancement of people of color, people with disabilities, low-income people, and senior citizens . Prior to his position at the Joint Center, Mr. Horrigan served as the Vice President for Policy and Research at TechNet, where he researched the National Broadband Plan and the economic impact of mobile applications. Before assuming his role at TechNet, Mr. Horrigan was a member of FCC Chairman Genachowski’s leadership team, which developed the National Broadband Plan. Mr. Horrigan designed and carried out the FCC’s first nationwide survey on broadband usage. He served with the Pew Internet and American Life Project for nine years as the Associate Director, studying internet and information technology consumption on computer and mobile devices. 
Mr. Horrigan began his career as a staff officer for the National Research Council’s Board on Science, Technology, and Economic Policy. He served as a senior legislative assistant and press secretary for a U.S. Congressman. Mr. Horrigan holds a B.A. in government and economics from the University of Virginia and a Ph.D. in public policy from the University of Texas at Austin.

Name: Hudson Hollister
Title: Founder and Executive Director
bio: Hudson Hollister is the founder and Executive Director of the Data Transparency Coalition. Prior to founding the Data Transparency Coalition, he served as counsel to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform of the U.S. House of Representatives and as an attorney fellow in the Office of Interactive Disclosure at the Securities and Exchange Commission. Before his government service, he was a securities litigator in the Chicago office of Latham & Watkins LLP.

Name: Alex Heit
Title: Policy Associate
bio: Alex Heit serves as the Policy Associate for the Data Transparency Coalition. He earned his MPA at the University of Pittsburgh with an emphasis on Policy Research and Analysis.

Name: Mike Kruger
Title: Director of Digital Engagement
bio: Mike Kruger has been the Director of Digital Strategy for the U.S. Department of Commerce since September 2010. He directs the Agency’s first-ever Office of Digital Engagement. He joined the Commerce Department after two years as the House Education and Labor committee's online outreach specialist, where he was charged with expanding the committee's social network footprint and reaching out to online media. He worked previously for 21st Century Democrats as an online associate during the 2007-2008 election cycle. Prior to that, he taught domestically and internationally for 9 years. He earned his Masters in Education and Social Justice from the University of London and holds a Bachelor of Arts in History from Western Washington University.

Name: David Langdon
Title: Senior Policy Advisor for Economics and Statistics

Name: David Michaud
Title: Acting Deputy Chief Information Officer
bio:
Mr. David L. Michaud is currently serving as National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Acting Deputy Chief Information Officer (CIO) as of May 2014. In this position, he is the chief operating officer for NOAA Office of the CIO and for policy and management of information and information technology across NOAA. Mr. Michaud is also the Deputy Director of High Performance Computing and Communications for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, responsible for the management, coordination, and integration of NOAA’s high performance computing, enterprise network infrastructure services, and information technology research and development.

Mr. Michaud has served at NOAA for over 20 years. Previously he was the Senior Production Analyst for the National Weather Service’s National Centers for Environmental Prediction where he was responsible for the management and operation of its numerical weather prediction suite of models running on NOAA’s operational supercomputers producing millions of public products daily.
Mr. Michaud earned a Bachelor of Science degree in meteorology from the Pennsylvania State University and began his career with NOAA working day-to-day operations within multiple National Weather Service Forecast Offices.

Name: Ron Bewtra
Title: Chief Technology Officer
bio: Ron Bewtra serves as the Chief Technology Officer for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA).  He is currently advancing the Agency's Big Data initiative.  He recently led the effort to establish the Agency’s 5-year network strategic plan and the implementation of a NOAA-wide network optimization initiative.  Mr. Bewtra also serves as the technical lead for the NOAA Research and Development High Performance Computing.  He is responsible for IT at NOAA’s Geophysical Fluid Dynamics Laboratory located on Princeton University’s Forrestal campus.

Name: Edward Johnson
Title: Director, Office of Strategic Planning and Policy (NWS)
bio:
Dr. Edward R. Johnson currently serves the National Weather Service (NWS) as the Director of Strategic Planning and Policy, a staff office reporting to the NWS Director, with responsibility for oversight of the NWS planning process and agency-level policy matters (including private sector relations).

Dr. Johnson works with government agencies as well as interest groups and non-governmental agencies to coordinate policy, service, science, and technology issues. Before assuming his current post in 1999, his NWS career included research, development, and policy-level activities associated with the NWS hydrologic services program including the NWS modernization and the centralized operational support for NWS flood forecast and warning systems.

Prior to joining the NWS hydrologic services program in 1983, Dr. Johnson was an Assistant Professor of Civil Engineering at the Georgia Institute of Technology, having earned his PhD from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology Department of Civil Engineering in 1978.

Name: Steven Olson
Title: Deputy Chair of the Environmental Data Management Committee (NWS)

Name: Bert Kaufman
Title: Deputy Director of our Office of Business Liaison

Name: Nancy Potok
Title: Deputy Director
bio:
Dr. Nancy Potok is the Deputy Director and Chief Operating Officer of the U.S. Census Bureau. She previously served at the U.S. Department of Commerce as Deputy Under Secretary for Economic Affairs, the Census Bureau's Associate Director for Demographic Programs, and the Principal Associate Director and Chief Financial Officer in charge of Field Operations, Information Technology, and Administration during the 2000 Census.

Dr. Potok has more than 30 years of public, private, and nonprofit senior management experience. She was the Chief Operating Officer of McManis & Monsalve Associates, a small business specializing in helping Fortune 500 companies and government agencies manage change and innovation. She was also the Senior Vice President and Director of the Economic, Labor and Population Studies Department at the University of Chicago National Opinion Research Center (NORC), a social science survey research organization.

Her public service includes working in the Judicial and Legislative Branches, as well as at the U.S. Department of Transportation and the U.S. Office of Management and Budget.

Dr. Potok is an adjunct professor at The George Washington University, an elected Fellow of the National Academy of Public Administration (NAPA), and a recipient of numerous awards, including The George Washington University Trachtenberg School Distinguished Alumni Award and the Arthur S. Flemming Award. She has published numerous articles on governmental management topics, and has presented papers, lectures, workshops, and classes in both national and international forums.

Dr. Potok earned her B.A. from Sonoma State University, M.A.S. from the University of Alabama, and Ph.D. from The George Washington University

Name: Avi Bender
Title: Chief Technology Officer
bio:
Avi Bender joined the Census Bureau as its first CTO in 2010. Avi guides technology modernization of the Bureau through strategic initiatives that will transform how survey data are collected, processed and disseminated. Avi has established an enterprise architecture program, an infrastructure road map and led the creation of the Bureau’s Innovation Center - the Center for Applied Technology. He leads a team of solution architects who are designing an agile, scalable, and responsive architecture and infrastructure to deliver both operational efficiencies and business process innovation.

Avi provides thought leadership in the areas of open data, innovation, service based architecture, and change management. Avi played a key role in the development of the Department of Commerce Strategic Plan- Data Goal- and represented the Department on the Presidents Management Agenda for Data. Avi led a Commerce-wide team in the development of a unified architecture and shared service strategy in support of the Operational Excellence Goal for the Department.

Prior to joining Census, Avi served a four-year term appointment as the Director for Enterprise Architecture (EA) at the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). Avi transformed the IRS EA organization into a business driven and collaborative function that delivered IT strategy, governance, and business enablement. He received multiple industry awards for changing the role of the IRS EA from “police” to a highly collaborative and mission focused organization. Avi has extensive entrepreneurial, executive management, and consulting experience in the private sector. Avi was a Managing Director at Price Waterhouse LLP where he led the global IT thought leadership support for digital media. As the Managing Principle for Media and Entertainment with IBM Global Services, Avi led major IT strategy consulting initiatives for some of the largest brands. Avi was a founder of two digital media software startups that delivered capabilities in enterprise content management and service oriented architecture.

Avi holds a Bachelor of Science in Biology from Brooklyn College, City University of New York, A Masters of Science in Marine Science from Long Island University, and a Masters of General Administration in Technology, from the University of Maryland, with a concentration in IT and organizational development. Avi received the Federal Innovator of the Year Award in 2013.

Name: Michael Ratcliffe
Title: Assistant Division Chief for Geocartographic Products and Criteria
bio: Michael Ratcliffe is responsible for programs related to development of geographic area concepts and criteria, geographic information and mapping products. In his tenure at the Census Bureau, he has worked in both the Geography and Population Divisions, with a general focus on urban/rural and metropolitan areas, and concepts of place. Mr. Ratcliffe holds degrees in geography from the University of Maryland and Oxford University.

Name: Jeffrey Sisson
Title: Program Manager, Data Access and Dissemination Systems

Name: Brian Moyer
Title: Acting Director
bio:
In his role as Acting Director, Dr. Moyer oversees BEA’s production of official economic statistics, which provide a comprehensive, up-to-date picture of U.S. economy that aid in the decision making by businesses, policymakers, households, and individuals. He took on the duties of Acting Director upon the May 2 retirement of Director Steve Landefeld.

As Deputy Director, Dr. Moyer also oversees the administrative and communications functions of the Bureau and provides leadership for improving and expanding the Bureau’s statistical programs.

Name: Nicole Mayerhauser
Title: Chief, National Income and Wealth Division
bio: Nicole Mayerhauser is chief of the National Income and Wealth Division at the Commerce Department’s Bureau of Economic Analysis. In that post, she directs the production of GDP statistics and is on the forefront of BEA’s efforts to improve how the U.S. economy is measured. Mayerhauser first joined the BEA in 1997 and left in early 2000 to work as a research economist at the U.S. Chamber of Commerce headquartered in Washington, D.C. Mayerhauser returned to the BEA in the spring of 2002, serving in a number of different positions, including chief of the Industry Sector Division, where she oversaw production of BEA’s GDP by industry statistics and the U.S. input-output accounts.

Name: Shaunda Villones
Title: Senior Economist and Special Assistant to the Director
bio: As Assistant to the Director, Shaunda Villones manages the operations of the Office of the Director and supervises a team that provides direct technical support to the Director and Deputy Director of BEA. Her team supports the Director and Deputy Director’s management, communication, administrative and economic research responsibilities.

Name: Alexander Minor
Title: Chief, Web Services Branch
bio: Alec Minor is the Web Services Branch Chief at the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis. Alec is responsible for the internal and external facing Web sites at the Bureau and coordinates with the program areas, OCIO, and the Communications Division on strategies and development of the sites. Over the last 6 years Alec has played a key role in implementation of the Bureaus’ interactive data tables, APIs, and cataloging of datasets and development of Web pages for open data accessibility.

Name: Vikrum Aiyer
Title: Special Advisor to the Under Secretary
bio:
Vikrum Aiyer is a political appointee in the Obama Administration and Deputy Chief of Staff to the Under Secretary of Commerce for IP. A former communications advisor to Senator Ed Markey (D-MA) and DC Mayor Adrian Fenty (D) he has worked on communications strategies for campaigns, federal agencies, and trade associations, including the State Department, the White House Initiative on Asian Americans & Pacific Islanders and the National Education Association.

Currently, he advises the President's Secretary & Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property, where he helps frame the Administration's innovation and intellectual property agenda. Aiyer also spearheads public engagement and IP-outreach strategies aimed at boosting exports for small businesses, spurring advanced manufacturing opportunities in America, and ripening the business climate for start-up growth. 

Aiyer attended the University of California, Berkeley and did his graduate work at the George Washington University’s School of Political Management. He lives in Washington, DC, where he serves on the steering committees for Refugees International, Big Brothers Big Sisters, and 
the Susan G. Komen Foundation.

Name: Ajay Kundaria
Title: Senior Advisor
bio:
Ajay Kundaria is a Senior Advisor to the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO).
 
Mr. Kundaria comes to the USPTO from practicing law in California, where his practice focused on counseling and representing individuals and startups in matters involving intellectual property, unfair competition, and disputes over corporate governance.  Prior to that, he spent several years litigating high stakes issues before state and federal courts with the law firm Keker & Van Nest LLP in San Francisco, and the American Civil Liberties Union of Northern California.  In addition, Mr. Kundaria worked on President Obama’s re-election campaign in 2012, leading its voting rights efforts in Northwest Ohio.
 
Mr. Kundaria is a graduate of Stanford University and The University of Chicago Law School.

Name: Hamid Ouyachi
Title: CTO
bio:
Hamid Ouyachi is the Chief Technology Officer at the Department of Labor (DOL), where he is responsible for articulating the future vision, strategy and roadmap for the use of technology to drive efficiency, employee engagement, and business innovation, with current focus on Cloud adoption, Mobility, Data Analytics, Visualization, and Open Government.

He chairs the DOL's Technology & Innovation forum aimed at employee-sourcing innovation to seed institutionalization, and drive creative application of technology to business problems. Mr. Ouyachi is also leading the DOL’s IT modernization and organizational change management effort.

He is the principal architect of the DOL’s open government flagship initiative, which has received mention in a presidential memo on regulatory compliance.

Mr. Ouyachi was educated at New York University and is a graduate of the Sorbonne.

Name: Emma Peck
Title: Legislative Correspondent
bio: Emma Peck is the Legislative Correspondent for Senator Mark R. Warner.

Name: Jeptha Nafziger
Title: Detalee, OMB
bio: Jeptha Nafziger serves on the staff of the U.S. Senate Committee on the Budget.

Organization: Office of Science and Technology Policy
Name: Erie Meyer
Title: Senior Advisor to the CTO
bio:
Erie Meyer is a Senior Advisor to the U.S. CTO at the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy, where she works on the President’s Open Data Initiatives.

Before joining the White House, Ms. Meyer worked at the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), where she was a member of the founding Tech + Innovation Team. She helped to develop and launch a system to collect consumer complaints about financial products and services, such as students loans and credit reporting, and then to publish the complaint data (Why Banks Are Scrambling To Hear Your Complaints). She also served as Editorial Director of the Digital Team, leading strategy to increase citizen participation in developing consumer finance regulations and to connect the public with better information about their rights as consumers. 

She also launched the first open source website for Ohio’s state government, led user research, and stood up a digital team in the Ohio Attorney General’s office at the time. She has also been part of the strategy team at Blue State Digital, working on student loan issues for Senator Ted Kennedy and campaigns like She Should Run, a nonpartisan effort to get more women in elected office.

Ms. Meyer is a co-founder of Tech Ladymafia, a group of women living everywhere from San Francisco to Shenzhen, China, working on anything from DIY circuit boards to theoretical physics. She was recently named one of Forbes’ 2014 “30 under 30” for technology.

Name: Haley Van Dyck
Title: Advisor
bio:
Haley Van Dyck serves as a Senior Technology Advisor at the White House where she works to unleash 21st-century technology in support of a more open, accessible, and citizen-centric government.

Ms. Van Dyck builds unconventional products that solve large-scale problems. Whether the solution is building technology tools, launching new programs from the ground up, writing policy, or fostering proactive community in the midst of bureaucracy…she lives to make things work better, cost less, and make people happier.

Name: Joel Gurin
Title: Project Director, Open Data 500
bio: Joel Gurin is Senior Advisor at the Governance Lab at NYU, where he directs the Open Data 500, a project to study companies that use government Open Data as a key business resource (OpenData500.com). He is the author of the new book, Open Data Now, and covers the field through his website, OpenDataNow.com. He was formerly Editorial Director and then Executive Vice President of Consumers Union and Consumer Reports. From late 2009 through early 2012 Joel Gurin was Chief of the Consumer and Governmental Affairs Bureau of the Federal Communications Commission. He also served as Chair of the White House Task Force on Smart Disclosure, which studied how the federal government can help consumers by providing information on complex choices in the marketplace. He tweets @joelgurin

Name: Laura Manley
Title: Project Manager, Open Data 500
bio:
Laura Manley is the Project Manager of the Open Data 500, the first comprehensive study of U.S. companies that use open government data to generate new business and develop new products and services.  She has over 10 years of experience working with NGOs and social enterprises in the US, South Asia, Sub-Saharan Africa and South America specializing in startup strategic planning and organizational development.

Ms. Manley is also the Director of Social Entrepreneurship Research at the NYU Stern School of Business and has worked with multiple development agencies including the United Nations Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights, the National Endowment for Democracy, UNICEF, and MasterCard Foundation. She holds a Bachelors in Business Administration from the University of Massachusetts Amherst and a Masters in Public Administration (May ’14) from NYU Wagner focusing on international policy and entrepreneurship.

Name: Katherine Garcia
Title: Research Assistant, Open Data 500
bio: Katherine Garcia earned her MPA with an emphasis in Policy Analysis from Baruch College. Prior to joining the Open Data 500 team, she served as the Press Assistant for the U.S. Mission to the United Nations. Ms. Garcia serves as the Co-President for the Board of Directors for the Metro NY Chapter of the U.S. National Committee for UN Women, which promotes gender equality and women’s empowerment. She serves on the Board of Directors for SustainUS, a non-profit that empowers youth to advance sustainable development.

Name: Luis Palacios
Title: Fellow
bio: Luis Daniel is originally from Monterrey, Mexico and is a recent graduate of the Interactive Telecommunications Program at Tisch School of the Arts in NYU. He worked as a Solomon Fellow at NYC Digital where he created and ran New York City government’s first official Spanish Twitter account, @NYCgob. During his time in graduate school, Luis focused on ways technology could help alleviate the problems Mexico faces because of the War on Drugs. In his past life, Luis worked on oil rigs in South Texas as a field engineer for an oilfield services company. He received his B.S. in Mechanical Engineering from The University of Texas at Austin.

Name: Audrey Ariss
Title: Research Assistant
bio: Audrey Ariss is a research assistant for Open Data 500. She is a recent graduate from Columbia University’s School of International and Public Affairs where she obtained a dual Masters in International Affairs and Applied Quantitative Methods, with foci on urban development and technology policy. She is a 2013 Google Policy Fellow. Audrey holds a bachelors in modern history and French from the University of Oxford, St. Catherine’s College.

Name: Stefaan Verhulst
Title: Chief Research and Development Officer of the Governance Laboratory
bio:
Stefaan G. Verhulst is Co-Founder and Chief Research and Development Officer of the Governance Laboratory @NYU  (GovLab) where he is responsible for building a research foundation on how to transform governance using advances in science and technology.

Mr. Verhulst’s latest scholarship centers on how technology can improve people’s lives and the creation of more effective and collaborative forms of governance. Specifically, he is interested in the perils and promise of collaborative technologies and how to harness the unprecedented volume of information to advance the public good.

Name: Arnaud Sahuguet
Title: Senior Technology Advisor
bio:
Dr Arnaud Sahuguet was until recently a Product Manager for Google.org in New York working on civic innovation, as part of the Google social impact team.

For the last two years, he has been working on mobile micro-donations (OneToday) and child protection (in collaboration with the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children). Before Google.org, he worked on Google Maps infrastructure and helped the Google Speech team productize its technology, with products such as GOOG-411 and Voice Search.

Before joining Google in 2006, he worked almost 5 years as a Member of Technical Staff at Bell Labs research, in Murray Hill, NJ, where he published numerous papers, worked on standards for user profile management in telecom networks, identity management, personalization and converged services.

Arnaud got his PhD from UPenn, on the topic of distributed query languages and optimization. While at UPenn, Arnaud founded Tropean Inc, to commercialize a screen scrapping technology for web sites. Before that, he graduated from Ecole Nationale des Ponts et Chaussées in France (MSc in Civil Engineering) and from Ecole Polytechnique (BS).

Name: Robyn Caplan
Title: Reseach Fellow
bio:
Robyn Caplan is a Research Fellow at the GovLab, and a SC&I Fellow and PhD student at Rutgers University’s School of Communication and Information Studies. Her research focuses on information and technology policy, with a specific emphasis on human information behavior, social and political issues emerging in the legislation of data. She earned her MA in Media, Culture, and Communication at Steinhadt’s School of Culture, Education, and Human Development, with a focus on Technology and Society where she worked with on determining jurisdictional issues emerging from remote data storage. She is the co-founder of AppAutopsy.com, an online application which uses data scraping and visualization to unveil the politics and values in digital applications.

Prior to accepting her fellowship at Rutgers, she worked as the Digital Editor for MAKERS.com, a PBS/AOL website on the history of the women’s movement in the United States. She has worked for numerous startups in multiple capacities, as a researcher, writer, and project manager. Robyn received her undergraduate degree from University of Toronto, and is originally from Ontario, Canada. She can be found on Twitter @RobynCaplan.

Name: Kristy Brown
Title: Research Assistant, Photographer
bio:
Kristy Brown is a first-year MPA candidate at NYU Wagner, specializing in Policy. Prior to Wagner, she served two years as an AmeriCorps member at City Year New York, was an inaugural staff member of NYC Service within the NYC Office of the Mayor, organized communities around water issues in Austin, Texas, and managed donor relations at Baruch College.

In addition to her coursework, Kristy currently serves as the co-chair of the City Year New York Alumni Board, and works as a freelance photographer. She is beyond thrilled to be working at the intersection of government and innovation with the GovLab. Kristy’s initial focus at the GovLab is on open data for the NHS project and communications. She tweets @brownkristine.
